size_t MGOpenGLView::attach_drawer ( MGCommandDrawer *  drawer  ) 

Attach to MGCommandDrawer.

Function's return value is the number of drawer's attached after attached.

const MGColor& MGOpenGLView::Bcolor (  )  const [inline]

Get color values, Bcolor:background color, Gcolor:Object color, Hcolor:hilighted object color.

const MGConstructionPlane& MGOpenGLView::construction_plane (  )  const [inline]

Clear all of the string displays.

void clear_string_display();

void MGOpenGLView::copy ( const MGOpenGLView &  glview2  ) 

Copy the informations of glview2 into this.

Data that is not copied from glview2 are: m_hRC(Rendering context), m_hDC(Device Context), m_object, m_display_list, m_eye_func, and m_sysgllist. m_hRC and m_hDC can be set using setDCRC(), m_object can be set by set_object(). m_eye_func by set_eye_func each. m_display_list can be made using make_display_list(). m_sysgllist must be made by invoking openGL's display list generation functions.

void MGOpenGLView::draw_string ( const CString &  str,
const MGPosition &  pos,
const MGColor *  color = 0 
)

Display string at the position pos with the color.

Parameters:
str String to display
pos position for the string to display at.
color color. When color=null, white color will be employed.

const MGPickObjects &  pobjs

bool MGOpenGLView::get_surface_parameter_glv ( const MGFSurface &  surf,
int  sx,
int  sy,
MGPosition &  uv 
) const

Get the surface parameter value uv(u,v) where screen coordinate (sx,sy) is projected on.

If no projection points are found, the nearest point to a perimeter of surf will be returned.

Parameters:
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
uv surface parameter (u,v) where (sx,sy) is projected on will be returned.
void MGOpenGLView::get_viewing_environment ( double &  neard,
double &  fard,
double &  maxsize,
MGPosition &  center,
double &  scale,
double &  cx,
double &  cy,
MGPosition &  eye,
MGVector &  up_vector,
double  currentMat[16] 
) const

Get the current viewing environment.

This output can be used for the parameters of initialize_viewing_environment, and thus the current environment that were save can be restored.

Parameters:
fard near and far data
center Model's size(diameter) and the center
cy Current viewing's scale, and panning data(cx, cy).
up_vector viewing eye position and view up vector These parameters are used fro gluLookAt. see the explanation.
currentMat OpenGL's ModelView current matrix.
void MGOpenGLView::get_viewport ( int  vp[4]  )  const

get viewport of OpenGL.

Parameters:
vp OpenGL's viewport will be output. (vp[0],vp[1]) is (left,bottom) coordinates. (vp[2],vp[3]) is (width, height) of the viewport.
void MGOpenGLView::initialize_viewing_environment ( const MGBox &  box,
int  view_num = 1 
)

Initialize the viewing environment.

Initialization is done by the parameter box or all the necessary environmental data. initialize_viewing_environment will invoke make_RC_current(), and so, on return from initialize_viewing_environment, the rendering context is guaranteed to be current.

Parameters:
view_num Standard view number: 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
void MGOpenGLView::initialize_viewing_environment ( double  neard,
double  fard,

double  cx,
double  cy,

)

fard near and far data
center Model's size(diameter) and the center
cy Current viewing's scale, and panning data(cx, cy).
up_vector viewing eye position and view up vector These parameters are used fro gluLookAt. see the explanation.
currentMat OpenGL's ModelView current matrix.
void MGOpenGLView::initialize_viewing_environment ( const MGPlane &  plane,
double  height,
bool  rotate = false 
)

Initialize the viewing environment to view objects projected onto a plane.

This view is 2D view. center of the object is the origin of the plane.

Parameters:
height height of the view, If rotate=true, height is the height after rotated.
rotate if true, 90 degree rotation will be performed for the plane. (-v_deriv, u_deriv) will be (x,y), If false, (u_deriv, v_deriv) will be (x,y).
MGPosition MGOpenGLView::locate_glv ( int  x,
int  y,
MGPosition *  uv = 0 
) const

locate the screen coordinate (x,y) in the 3D world coordinate.

(x, y)'s origin is (left, bottom) of the screen. In uv, the construction plane's parameter(u,v) coordinate will be returned.

void MGOpenGLView::make_construction_plane ( const MGBox &  bx,
int  view_num = 1 
)

construct the construction plane along with its display list.

Parameters:
view_num Standard view number: 1: 3D perspective view, 2:(x,y) 2D view, 3:(y,z) 2D view, 4:(z,x) 2D view 0: non standard view.
void MGOpenGLView::make_construction_plane ( const MGPosition &  mid,
const MGVector &  uderi,
const MGVector &  vderi,
double  uspan,
double  vspan,
size_t  ulnum,
size_t  lnum 
)
Parameters:
mid center of the construction plane.
uderi u-axis vector of the construction plane.
vderi v-axis vector of the construction plane.
uspan span length between the lines along u-axis.
vspan span length between the lines along v-axis.
ulnum number of lines to draw along u-axis.
lnum number of lines to draw along v-axis.
size_t MGOpenGLView::make_display_list ( const MGGroup &  grp  ) 

Make openGL display list of a standard mgl file in the input glview.

A standard mgl file means that all the objects are read into a MGGroup object, and that the objects are the target to make display list. If this is not the case, make display list as follows: 1. Name the display list as e.g. NAME, and generate the display list by glNewName. 2. Store all the data to display in the display list NAME. (Sometimes glCallList may be useful.) At this time, use glPushName() whose list name is size_t(MGObject*). MGOpenGLView's pick() will return the MGObject* when pick() is invoked. 3. Let MGOpenGLView know the list NAME by invoking set_display_list().

void MGOpenGLView::make_RC_current (  )  const [inline]

Each viewport uses its own context, so we need to make sure the correct context is set whenever we make an OpenGL command.

void MGOpenGLView::pan_zoom ( int  x0,
int  y0,
int  x1,
int  y1 
)

Translate and scale the current view.

(x0, y0) to (x1,y1) is the rectangle of screen coordinate whose origin is (left,bottom).

void MGOpenGLView::pan_zoom ( const MGBox &  box  ) 

Translate and scale the current view.

box is the world coordinate's box cube.

const MGEdge* MGOpenGLView::pick_edge_glv ( const MGFace &  f,
int  sx,
int  sy,
MGPosition *  uv = 0,
double  aperturex = -1.,
double  aperturey = -1. 
)

Pick an edge of the face f.

That is, obtain the edge number that passes input (sx,sy) when drawn in the current view matrix. Function's return value is the edge pointer picked. When no edges are picked, null will be returned.

Parameters:
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
uv surface parameter (u,v) nearest to (sx,sy) will be returned.
aperturex specifies pick aperture of x and y.
aperturey When <=0. value is specified, default value(the value obtained by pick_aperture() will be used.
MGPickObjects MGOpenGLView::pick_glv ( MGCL::VIEWMODE  vmode,
int  sx,
int  sy,
double  aperturex = -1.,
double  aperturey = -1.,
const MGAbstractGels &  objtype = mgAll_Object,
bool  get_param = true 
)

Pick objects in the display list generated by make_display_list.

Function's return value is MGPickObject vector. All the objects which were inside the pick aperture will be output. This data can be accessed using current_object()cy or current_PickObject(). pick will invoke make_RC_current();

Parameters:
vmode View mode of the document.
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
aperturex specifies pick aperture of x and y.
aperturey When <=0. value is specified, default value(the value obtained by pick_aperture() will be used.
objtype Target object kind. See MGGEL_KIND in "mg/types.h" or "mg/default.h"
int MGOpenGLView::pick_perimeter_glv ( const MGSurface &  surf,
int  sx,
int  sy,
MGPosition *  uv = 0,
double  aperturex = -1.,
double  aperturey = -1. 
)

Pick a perimeter of the surface surf.

That is, obtain the perimeter number that passes input (sx,sy) when drawn in the current view matrix. Function's return value is perimeter number picked. When no perimeters are picked, -1 will be returned.

Parameters:
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
uv surface parameter (u,v) nearest to (sx,sy) will be returned.
aperturex specifies pick aperture of x and y.
aperturey When <=0. value is specified, default value(the value obtained by pick_aperture() will be used.
int MGOpenGLView::pick_start_end_glv ( const MGCurve &  curve,
int  sx,
int  sy 
)

Determine if screen coordinate (sx,sy) is closer to the start point or to the end of the curve curve.

Functin's return value is 0: if start point, 1: if end point.

Parameters:
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
int MGOpenGLView::pick_to_select_buf ( int  sx,
int  sy,
double  aperturex,
double  aperturey,
size_t  display_list,
size_t  buf_size,
GLuint *  selectBuf,
GLint *  viewport = 0,
GLdouble *  modelMatrix = 0,
GLdouble *  projMatrix = 0 
)

Function's return value is the number of hit objects.

Parameters:
sy Screen coordinates. (left, bottom) is (0,0).
aperturey specifies pick aperture of x and y.
display_list display list that includes pick objects.
selectBuf selected objects will be output in selectBuf inthe form of OpenGL.
viewport view port will be output for the pick operation.
modelMatrix model matrix will be output for the pick operation.
projMatrix projection matrix will be output for the pick operation.
void MGOpenGLView::project ( const MGPosition &  world,
MGPosition &  screen,
const double *  modelMat = 0,
const double *  projlMat = 0,
const int *  vp = 0 
) const

project world coordinates to OpenGL's screen coordinates.

If modelMat, projMat, or vp is not input, project will ask OpenGL to get them. Generally, users of project are recommended to get modelMat, projlMat, or vp, and input them to project. Before use of project, SetContext() must be invoked.

Parameters:
modelMat OpenGL's model matrix
projlMat OpenGL's projection matrix
vp OpenGL's viewport
size_t MGOpenGLView::push_back_to_sysgl ( size_t  fc,
const MGGel *  oi = 0 
) [inline]

Push back (function_code, object id) to the end or the beginning of system display list.

Function's return value is the display list name to use for glNewList. sysgl can be handled(can be erased after the generation) by (1)function code fc (2)object id oi(in other words, object name). If the system display list is to handle by the id(object name), oi must be meaningful. Usually oi is recommended to be the object pointer. If display list handling is not intended by the object id, set oi as null. size_t push_back_to_sysgl(size_t fc, MGGel* oi=0){return m_sysgllist.push_back(fc,oi);}; size_t push_front_to_sysgl(size_t fc, MGGel* oi=0){return m_sysgllist.push_front(fc,oi);};

size_t MGOpenGLView::push_back_to_sysgl ( mgSysGL *  sysgl  )  [inline]

Push back (function_code, object id) to the end or the beginning of system display list.

sysgl must be a newed object, and the ownership will be transfered to this.

void MGOpenGLView::rotate ( double  angle,
double  x,
double  y,
double  z 
)

Rotate the current view by the angle along the vector(x,y,z), performs a counterclockwise rotation of angle angle about the vector from the origin through the point (x, y, z).

void MGOpenGLView::set_eye_func ( Compute_eye_func  eye_func  )  [inline]

Set the eye position computing function.

this function is used wnly when the following function is invoked. "void initialize_viewing_environment(const MGBox& box);"

void MGOpenGLView::set_frustum (  )  const

Set Projection matrix of OpenGL.

set_frustum() will NOT invoke glLoadIdentity() first, so before use of set_frustum(), glLoadIdentity() must be invoked.

void MGOpenGLView::set_model_matrix (  ) 

Set Model_View matrix of OpenGL.

set_model_matrix() will invoke glLoadIdentity() first.

void MGOpenGLView::set_object ( void *  object  )  [inline]

Set Object pointer who uses this MGOpenGLView.

This pointer will be passed to Compute_eye_func as the 1st parameter as (*Compute_eye_func)(m_object,eye,m_eyeP).

void MGOpenGLView::set_perspective ( bool  pers  )  [inline]

Set if this view is a perspective view(true), or orthnormal view(falsle) , m_perspective.

void MGOpenGLView::setDCRC ( HDC  dc,
HGLRC  rc 
)

Set redering context.

setDCRC will invoke make_RC_current();

void MGOpenGLView::SwapGLBuffers (  )  [inline]

SwapGLBuffers does not invoke make_RC_current() which is necessary before use of SwapGLBuffers.

void MGOpenGLView::unproject ( int  x,
int  y,
MGStraight &  sl,
MGCSisect &  is 
) const

Convert the windows screen coordinate (x,y) to MGCL's straight line.

and get the intersection of the straight line and the construction plane. The origin of the screen coordinate is left, bottom. Not left, top. The direction of the sl is from the screen to the viewer.

Parameters:
y screen coordinate whose origin is (left, bottom).
sl The straight line of (x,y) will be returnred.
is the intersectio of the sl and the construction plane will be returned.
void MGOpenGLView::unproject_to_sl_glv ( int  x,
int  y,
MGStraight &  sl 
) const

Convert the windows screen coordinate (x,y) to MGCL's straight line.

The origin of the screen coordinate is left, bottom. Not left, top. The direction of the sl is from the screen to the viewer.

Member Data Documentation

MGPosition MGOpenGLView::m_center [protected]

m_center and m_diameter define a sphere whose center and diameter are m_center and m_diameter.

The sphere includes the whole model. World coordinate of the center of the document.

MGPosition MGOpenGLView::m_center_current [protected]

2. Dynamic atributes(depend what is current viewing environment).

Current center after transformations.

double MGOpenGLView::m_cx [protected]

center of the screen in world coordinate (when the center of the screen is supposed to be (0.,0.

)). Or (-m_cx, -m_cy) is the current panning translation distance.

size_t MGOpenGLView::m_display_list [protected]

Display list name of the document which is displayed on this glview.

This is used for glNewList display list name. m_display_list=0 indicates no display list is generated for this glview.

Compute_eye_func MGOpenGLView::m_eye_func [protected]

3. Others.

function to compute eye position. this function is used wnly when the following function is invoked. "void initialize_viewing_environment(const MGBox& box);"

double MGOpenGLView::m_fovy [protected]

angle of top and bottom viewing pyramid in degrees.

See gluPerspective's fovy. If m_perspective=false, m_fovy is not used.

int MGOpenGLView::m_line_density [protected]

1. Static atributes(usually not changed after this is initaialized)

line density for a surface to draw in wire mode.

void* MGOpenGLView::m_object [protected]

Generally this is a pointer who uses this MGOpenGLView.

However, this is only used for Compute_eye_func to receive as the 1st parameter of their argumets: as (*Compute_eye_func)(m_object,eye,m_eyeP).

MGOpenGLView* MGOpenGLView::m_parent_glView [protected]

アトリビュート

0. If this OpenGLView has the parent, the pointerwill be set. The parent means all of the display list are shared with the parent's, and on this drawScene's invocation, the parent's display list will be drawn.

bool MGOpenGLView::m_perspective [protected]

Indicate if this is perspective or orthographic view.

true if perspective.

double MGOpenGLView::m_smooth [protected]

Smoothness of the curves to draw.

1/smooth is the division number of a curve whose length is the window width. When smooth becomes small, smoothness increases.

mgSysGLList MGOpenGLView::m_sysgllist

construction plane;

System display list manager.
